09:50 - lift 2 reported out of service by a customer, CSA investigated & confirmed this. CSM & CSA attend lift to attempt fix
09:52 - female customer speaks with CSS on PHP and demands that someone fix the lift immediately CSS assures her that staff will attempt to fix the lift and asks customer to stay where she is and that assistance is coming.
09:54 - CSM & CSA start assessing the status of the lift, whilst female customer informs CSS that she is coming to the ticket hall where she expects to have a taxi waiting for her.
09:57 - female customer arrives at control room & speaks with CSS who advises her that the CSM needs to authorise any taxi & the CSM has gone to try to fix the lift as the customer requested. The female customer then becomes extremely angry & begins shouting at CSS who tries to assure her that the CSM will return as soon as they are able & address the issue of a taxi. The female customer begins to cry and swears at CSS, telling CSS 'you're such a fucking disappointment', 'fuck off' & 'stop fucking talking to me'. CSS obeys this request.
10:10 approx. - CSM returns to ticket hall to speak with female customer and finds her shouting at other customers and any staff in the vicinity that she is being prevented from travelling & that she will not stop shouting until she gets a taxi. CSM finds communication difficult and the female customer then blocks the control room door with her wheelchair, preventing any access to the SOR for some minutes. CSS is trapped inside the SOR.
10:15 approx. - CSM calls BTP for assistance as the female customer is blocking entry to the SOR and is being uncommunicative due to her anger. During this time the female customers makes a number of false claims, that she has been forced to come to the ticket hall, that staff have refused to help her, that she is being unlawfully detained, & that staff are being abusive to her.
10:25 - the female customer calms down and moves away from the control room door and CSM arranges a taxi to take her to Waterloo (customer refuses any other solution).
10:36 - female customer leaves station with CSA and refers to CSS as a 'cunt' as she leaves.
After the incident, a busker reports that he was verbally abused as he signed in during the incident. The customer called him 'fucking useless' and a 'cunt'.
DESCRIPTION_IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS: female customer became angry that lift 2 was out of service and was abusive and blocked access to the control room as a protest.

1638 Ruislip radioed, while i was putting up circuit posters on the eastbound platform, to inform me that a disturbance was reported on train 431 approaching me.
Uxbridge supervisor then radioed to inform that the incident started on the platform at uxbridge and when she went to investigate it was a dispute between partners and it was not violent.
 As the train pulled in the platform, customers hurried me onto the train as there was an black lady, late 20s/early 30s harassing a white male, 60s/70s and a large group of youths around her trying to get her to leave the male alone.
i pressed the PEA to hold the train on the platform and asked the lady to get off the train as she was holding everyone up. She started to shout at me and other customers on the train and proceeded to tell the male ' give me money and I'll go' 
Despite the protesting from myself and the customers, the male gave her £20 and in the end she got off, not before hurling insults at everyone on board.
I called Met info to inform them I was the one that pulled the pea and the incident has been resolved, i then walked up to thedriver and informed him that he was okay to leave.
1643 train 431 departed.
 As i walked back to the lady I found her urinating on the platform and i informed her that she needed to leave the station however she refused. 
1645 Train 432 pulled in and she boarded, i called met info again and asked to hold the train and asked Uxbridge to call call BTP, MET info then informed me that BTP was en route to the station. (met info ref 442, Uxbridge ref 453121223) 
she refused to get off the train stating that she needed to go to Hammersmith i told her that the train would not be moving with her on the train.
Customers advised her that the train would not take her to Hammersmith she'd need the Piccadilly line and she got off. I called back Met info and said it was okay for 432 to leave as she was on it, she needed the Piccadilly train.
1649 Train 432 departed.
it was decided that 433 would non stop at the station to avoid further disruptions and delays.
I told her she needed to leave the station and she hurled abuse at me and started to curse me out. saying things 'you evil bitch, get a job, you fat bitch, i'll kill you, i'll punch you up, you fucking cunt' etc
As we approached the bottom of the stairs she proceeded to grab my hair and drag me she attempted to drag me down but was unable to. she then kept trying to reach for me. 
After a lot of back and forth we made our way upstairs i went into the office to get a BWC (237584) and made my way back out where she was requesting a cigarette from a customer. 
She hurled more abuse and after more back and forth she left the premises. 
I informed MET info that she had left and i called Ruislip, Ruislip Manor and Rayners lane at the request of MET info to give them a description of the lady. DRM Ian Dacosta, CSM Dean Landis, CSM Mark Renard came to do a duty of care. BTP (PC2678) arrived to take a statement.
DESCRIPTION_IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS: domestic situation, woman was clearly either on drugs/drunk or on a come down. she was very erratic and fidgety

DESCRIPTION:
Aldgate bound E431 was delayed departing platform 2 Eastcote following the operation of a Passenger Emergency Alarm (PEA) in car 21048 due to an altercation between two customers in the carriage.

The Train Operator informed the Metropolitan Line Service Controller about the incident but declined to attend for fear of his own safety. He was under the initial impression that approximately 20 customers were involved in a fight in car 8. The Eastcote Customer Service Supervisor (CSS) and the Metropolitan Line Duty Reliability Manager (DRM) were tasked to attend.

The British Transport Police were summoned (reference 442).

A 6 minute delay was recorded.
DESCRIPTION_IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS:
Abridged Incident Timeline

1638 hours - PEA car 8 E431 P2 Eastcote station. CSS, DRM and BTP tasked to attend following a report of an altercation between customers on board the train.

The incident had started at Uxbridge station at approximately 1625 hours when a Customer Service Assistant reported a verbal altercation between a male customer (approximately 70 years old) and a female customer (aged between 25 and 30) on platform 2. Both customers reportedly knew each other. Both customers boarded E431 on platform 2 just prior to it's departure.

1645 hours - The aggressive and abusive female customer in car 8 is assisted off the train and onto the platform at Eastcote by fellow customers. E431 departs after the PEA in car 21048 has been re-set.

The attending CSS reports that the female customer, as reported by the staff at Uxbridge earlier, was verbally harassing her elderly male companion for money. She states that customers in the carriage got involved in the altercation in a bid to stop the verbal harassment. After being assisted onto the platform by fellow customers, the CSS reports that the anti social female customer pulled down her jogging pants and urinated on the platform. The customer discarded the pants she was wearing on the platform in favour of another she had with her.

1646 hours - The anti social female customer boards E432 upon it's arrival on platform 2 Eastcote. The Metropolitan Line Service Controller holds all eastbound services at Uxbridge whilst the Eastcote CSS attempts to persuade the female customer to alight from the train. 

1650 hours - E432 departs Eastcote after the female customer is convinced to alight from the train after she is assured that it would not be going to her destination; Hammersmith. Eastbound services non-stopping platform 2.

The Eastcote CSS reports that the abusive and aggressive female customer threatened to kill her (multiple times), called her a " dirty African b**** " and pulled her by the hair prior to leaving the station by the main exit. The CSS proceeded to advise staff at stations either side of Eastcote to expect the female customer who was determined to get to Hammersmith.

1707 hours - The Metropolitan Line DRM arrives at Eastcote station and assesses the CSS's physical and metal state following her assault by the female customer. The Harrow Customer Service Manager arrives and attends to the CSS's immediate welfare prior to offering access to local Trauma Support resources.

1709 hours - Two BTP officers arrive at Eastcote station. They take a brief description off the assailant and details of her last known location outside the station before heading off in search.

Basic Cause:

On-board customer altercation that commenced on the platform at Uxbridge station and culminated in the racial and physical abuse of the Eastcote Customer Service Supervisor.

From 09:00 hrs onwards multiple members of the public are forcing open the paddles of the WAG gate who are assumed to be fare evading. It is also assumed that they are attending the local education establishments. Staff have removed themselves to a place of safety. There actions create an unpleasant environment for staff and customers.
 - Anti-Social Behaviour - Revenue Dispute / Touting - Employee did not request support from their manager
DESCRIPTION_IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS: Fare evasion is historically high on the London Underground network. Some members of the general public are familiar with how easy it is to force open the paddles of the wide isle gate (WAG) at the station gate line. This is in order to pass through it without paying for their journey. The fare evasion at Barons Court station is generally low in comparison with other stations that I have previously worked at. However, during  commute times of the attendees (students) of local colleges near to the station, fare evasion takes place at an unacceptable level. Station staff have reported this multiple times on the WAASB reporting app, but nothing is done to respond to this issue. Station staff are  concerned to see a deterioration in the behaviour of the students. They have been witnessed forcing open the staff access lid of the WAG  in order to operate the key pad inside. When the lid is difficult to open they kick it causing damage. They also cause an inconvenience to other customers when they occasionally don't wait for their turn to pass through the gate. Then further delay for the customer as the gate alarm re-sets itself. Station staff can also be faced with the complaints from paying customers. These complaints are often made in an unpleasant  and insulting manner. This is creating a very unpleasant environment for station staff and customers. It is also affecting the operation of the station. This is when station staff remove themselves to a place of safety and the WAG is required to be left open owing to the damage caused by it being excessively forced open by the public. The gate can be in the open position for a whole day while spare parts are being arranged by CUBIC. Owing to the type of criminality that is now taking place, staff have reported this directly to the BTP via their online rail worker facility. This is an historical ongoing issue.

DESCRIPTION:
Multiple customer reports received of a vagrant sleeping on a bench on Northbound Victoria Line Platform 
21:56 - CSM and CSA17 investigated. IC2 male found laying on bench approx. half way down platform. Wearing all black with bloody bandages around their knuckles. CSM and CSA17 interacted with Male, requesting that he sit up, Male told staff to "go f**k yourselves" and put their middle finger up at staff. CSM informed male that the police would be called, male responded "call the f**king police" 
22:05 - BTP requested. ref 610. 
Due to males aggression staff not left downstairs and CSM attempted to monitor male on CCTV but was unable to due to blind spot on platform
22:10 - CSM requested CSA28 to confirm on their security check if male was still on NB platform
22:16 - CSA28 informed CSM that male was no longer on platform. 
CSM cancelled BTP requested,
DESCRIPTION_IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS:
Male laying/sleeping on bench on northbound platform was abusive to staff when asked to sit up/move on
BTP requested but male left of own accord before they attended.

DESCRIPTION:
2330hrs CSA CN25 contacted the control room via connect radio to report a disturbance on the gate line, Mediterranean Male customer  aged around 26 to 30 years old was about to assault a customer exiting the station, CSA CN72 quickly stepped in before  the customer was punched. CSA CN27 tried to calm him down but he became abusive claiming this was the second time his mobile phone and vape was stolen on the train.  He was advised to write down his name and email address and if any item fitting the lost property description was found, he would be contacted.
He gave his details and all of a sudden he became aggressive  and he was about to attack CN72, CSA 27 quickly  blocked the assault. He started shouting abuses at staff. CN03 immediately informed all member of staff on the gate line to proceed into the supervisor's room as a place of safety.
2345 Mr OE left the station.
2345hrs BTP contacted on 109, reference 668-11122023 obtained While on the phone to BTP, he came back into the station with a bottle of alcohol and he punched MS YZ  in the face while she was  leaving the station on the unpaid side and she fell on the floor in shock. She was given duty of care and a glass of water. She was visibly shaken, she left the station at 00:05hrs. MR OE forced his way through WAG 22 and head-butted  a male customer that just got off T217 on stair case of Platform 2/3 on his way out of the station.
2351hrs he left the station on Westbound Circle Line T217.
SC informed on auto 104.
Multiple station towards Edgware contacted.
2352hrs BTP arrived on site.
00:00hrs Bayswater CSS contacted CSS DN03, Mr OE was sighted leaving the station, BTP officers made their way to Bayswater.
00:16hrs MR OE was arrested at Bayswater station.
DESCRIPTION_IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS: Customer under the influence of alcohol claimed his personal belongings were stolen verbal and physically assaulted  customers and staff at Gloucester Road station.

DESCRIPTION:

I must specify that there was no verbal communication between me and her before or after.
DUTYOFCARE: A Duty of Care was provided and a full EIRF has been completed. Rodica has subsequently gone sick.

"Assault Type: Verbal
Specific Assault Type: Threat
Location of Accident: Station
Specific Location: Maryland Station
Summary of Events: At Maryland station, Inside Barriers Observing gates for tailgaters IC3 male tried to validate an iPhone for exit. He said he had come from Stratford and validated his iPhone there. I requested him to try as IPhone uses NFC and works mostly even if very little battery, else he will be charged extra. He tried, however, never tried to press the power button on the iPhone to switch it on. I then requested him for his details explaining the procedure. He doubled behind another customer, walked a bit and came back, saying I should have just believed him and swore calling me an idiot. I said, you just came from Stratford which is a two minutes journey, and you just doubled behind so how do you expect me He then invited me to a fight outside, so I said, you did what you did, leave now. He then threatened me with stabbing so I moved away from him. When Alex challenged him, he repeated the threat again that he would come inside and stab me. I called 999
Body Cam: Yes
End of report"
